alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Boyle; Casey; Garrard; Green; Jessamine; Marion; Mercer; Taylor; Washington; Woodford (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 7:11PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Mercer, southern Woodford, northwestern Garrard, southeastern Anderson, southeastern Green, southeastern Marion, Taylor, western Jessamine, southeastern Washington, Boyle, northwestern Casey and Adair Counties through 745 PM EDT/645 PM CDT/... At 710 PM EDT/610 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles south of Lawrenceburg to 9 miles northeast of Edmonton. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Harrodsburg around 720 PM EDT. Columbia around 630 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Nicholasville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT/1000 PM CDT/ for south central and central Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Anderson; Boyle; Casey; Garrard; Green; Jessamine; Marion; Mercer; Taylor; Washington; Woodford
